Half-Life is definitely a game-changing FPS, inspired by the classics but also genre-breaking.

The first half of the game was very long and pretty repetitive. Although that kind of makes sense (since they're in a giant underground lab), it also made the first half of the game feel very grindy (for lack of a better term). I just felt that I had to power through the game in order to play Half-Life 2 and that drove me to get to the second half. I found the second half of the game to be much more fun.

Looking back on my 12 hours of playtime (not sure if that's too short/long/just right), I had a lot of fun. I really enjoyed a game that came out years ago, and now realize why people love the game the way they do.

You can play Half-Life: Source to have better lighting and water effects. You can play Black Mesa though it's a remake more than a port and some things like level design change a lot.

Half-life defined the first-person shooter genre and will always be talked about.

It's a flawless game, a masterpiece. I have no other words to describe it. There's no need to say anything else, it really is as good as everyone says. If you have this in your backlog, do yourself a favor and finish this game immediately.

Playing it for the first time in 2019, I still understand why this game receives so much praise.
The gunplay is quite excellent and the fact that the player advances the narrative by traversing through "continuous levels" kinda helps the storytelling and the overall immersion greatly. I have to say that storywise I prefer this one over it's sequel due to the lack of "forced-to-stand-in-place-while-the-characters-I-only-slightly-care-about-have-their-mandatory-interactions-with-each-other" parts. Not even the excellently realized and intentionally vagueish scripts have managed to make those scenes interesting enough for more than a single occasion (not in-game anyway since they're unskippable despite that fact that they tend to drag on, meh, guess that HL2 wasn't really made with replayability in mind).
This one howewer doesn't have even that single hiccup. It's just pure puzzle-solving gameplay combined with some FPS madness occassionally sprinkled with a few(!) expositional scripted sequences happening basically only at the two opposite ends of the experience.

Man, this game alongside with the first Turok must have been like a fever dream back in 1997-8. :D

Zerei agora, 20/09/2019, levando 26.8 horas no Hard. Ao mesmo tempo, estou maravilhado e aliviado. Maravilhado pois este jogo √© muito bem feito, te desafia de diversas formas, seja lutando contra soldados, que s√£o muito xaropes, mas que nem se comparam aos aliens que surgem conforme o jogo avan√ßa, ou te desafiando no "parkour" que n√£o √© somente pular, mas pular no lugar certo e na hora certa, te desafia no poupar recursos (vida, muni√ß√£o, HEV), e para tudo isso precisa ter estrat√©gia, precisa se esconder, utilizar as armas mais indicadas para cada situa√ß√£o e as vezes at√© se aproveitar de alguma limita√ß√£o do jogo (foi lan√ßado em 1998 se n√£o me engano) para que consiga derrotar um Gargantua, por exemplo.

Aliviado pois, cara, que jogo estressante! Conforme avan√ßa, o jogo vai se tornando muito dif√≠cil e muito desafiante. Alguns epis√≥dios s√£o mais curtos, mas alguns outros s√£o muito extensos e o quick save √© o que salvou, pois do contr√°rio eu estaria at√© agora tentando zerar. Em v√°rios momentos o correto n√£o √© simplesmente meter bala, mas usar esse "cabe√ß√£o de ET" que vos fala pra pensar em algum caminho para escapar, algum lugar para se esconder e alguma forma de matar o inimigo tomando o m√≠nimo dano poss√≠vel. Alguns epis√≥dios, sobretudo aqueles que os "alien controllers" surgem, aliados aos "alien slaves", voc√™ toma hit de todos os lados enquanto tem que se equilibrar numa pedra e tentar saltar para outra. √â um verdadeiro inferno e algumas vezes eu achei que n√£o ia conseguir hauhau. 

Os inimigos deste jogo s√£o MUITO BEM PENSADOS, e at√© os mais fracos deles conseguem ser muito irritantes, como √© o caso do headcrab (p√£ozinho de forma) ou o filhotinho de headcrab que surge no boss Gonarch. Assim tamb√©m s√£o as armas, que voc√™ perceber√° ser cada uma delas √∫teis a uma situa√ß√£o espec√≠fica.

Esse jogo √© primoroso, e pretendo zerar toda a franquia, mas vejo agora que vou levar um certo tempo. Sobre o pre√ßo, creio que √© um dos primeiros que eu penso valer o valor integral, sem promo√ß√£o, ainda que seja muito antigo. Claro, eu comprei num pacot√£o em promo e valeu total a pena, pois j√° tenho o resto na biblioteca esperando pra ser baixado.

This is the very first video game I ever played, if there is only one thing that I can say about this game, then I don't know what to choose. 

The single-player is a well crafted masterpiece, plenty of replay-ability, AI is more advanced than even up to today's standards, etc. etc. 

The multiplayer truly stood out in my list of multiplayer games, maps were constantly being made in its prime time, plenty of moddability, plenty of weapons (a few of them took actual concept and creativity), and it had one of the best communities I've gladly been a part of in my days. 

The majority who read this are probably gonna be the 14 of you older men in their 50's - 60's, hell maybe even one related to me, but I approve this game 110%

I gave it more chances than it'll ever deserve. The game has purely fantastical physics from an undiscovered dimension and gameplay that is more repetitive and bland than any NES game you can think of. Age can only be a viable excuse to a certain limit. The team ai is unapologetically finicky, to the point where giving simple commands, like "follow" requires a slow, painful method of path orientation that really feels like language translation. The enemy ai is simple and blunt with nothing to offer, the only challenge this game offers comes from the bullet-spongey enemies. As for the plot: there is no plot. Gordon Freeman goes to work, an experimental mishap happens, and he runs around shooting things. That's pretty much it. There are no conversations or unique events like in the game that led you to this travesty. Imagine Half-life 2 only with bad ai, terrible physics, and no plot. Got that fresh in your head? Good. Now be grateful that the 90s are over.
